sources.title: Streets of New York (1939)
sources.description: Jimmy, an idealistic and hard-working young man, has just arrived in New York City with dreams of making his fortune. Along the way he faces numerous obstacles, opportunities and temptations, but through it all, he considers the actions of his hero, Abraham Lincoln, for guidance. Will Jimmy see his dreams come true, or will he be another of the countless hopefuls chewed up and spit out by New York's mean streets? Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/streets-of-new-york-1939/

sources.title: Streets of New York (1939) The story of a kid who was tough enough to go straight!
sources.description:
Jimmy Keenan (Jackie Cooper) battles to stay on the straight and narrow, fending off gang pressure and his criminal brother Tap (Dick Purcell) while chasing his dream of becoming a lawyer. When Tap’s crimes hit too close to home, Jimmy takes a stand, proving he’s tougher than the streets trying to break him.

Original title: Streets of New York (1939) 

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/WNMkGHUXdpI


Director: William Nigh https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2gsu7VGzgdZXzNlrriwdV2VH5iA9980j
Writer: Robert Hardy Andrews
Actors: Jackie Cooper, Martin Spellman, Marjorie Reynolds, Dick Purcell

Genres: Action, Crime, Drama
Release date: April 12, 1939
Filming location: United States


@CultCinemaClassics
